util

Class IDManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • util.IDManager

  • public class IDManager
extends Object
    The IDManager distributes and maintains a set of unique IDs.

    Instantiate the IDManager at whatever scope you desire the ID uniqueness.

    Author:
    Kyle

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      IDManager()
      Construct an IDManager object with a default starting ID of 0.
      IDManager(long start)
      Construct an IDManager object with a starting ID of start.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Register to get a new ID.

      Retire ID ID.

    • Constructor Detail

      • IDManager

        public IDManager()
        Construct an IDManager object with a default starting ID of 0.

      • IDManager

        public IDManager(long start)
        Construct an IDManager object with a starting ID of start.
        Parameters:
        start - the ID the IDManager will start registering with

    • Method Detail

      • retire

        public void retire(String ID)
        Retire ID ID.

        If this ID was not previously registered, it prints out a warning. Otherwise it adds it to the available ID queue.

        WARNING: as number of Messages increase, may cause linearly increasing latency, due to iterating through an array of used IDs.

        Parameters:
        ID - the ID to be retired

      • register

        public String register()
        Register to get a new ID.
        Returns:
        a new, unused ID, by default the lowest available ID
